snippet: The discussion about targeting a citizen, who is believed to be plotting terrorist attacks, is the first time officials have considered killing an American overseas since President Obama imposed limits on drone strikes in May.
abstract: Obama administration is debating whether to authorize drone strike against an unidentified American citizen living in Pakistan who some believe is actively plotting terrorist attacks; it is first time officials have considered killing an American overseas since Pres Obama imposed limits on drone strikes in May 2013.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: The discussion about targeting a citizen, who is believed to be plotting terrorist attacks, is the first time officials have considered killing an American overseas since President Obama imposed limits on drone strikes in May.

headline.main: U.S. Debates Drone Strike on American Terrorism Suspect in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Debates Drone Strike on American

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
